intro: Ardisia beibeinensis, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, urn-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, preferring moist, shaded environments in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are glossy and dark green, while its berries are red and edible, though some parts of the plant contain toxic compounds. Ardisia beibeinensis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
